metadata.title: CVE-2024-7348 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) race condition in pg_dump in PostgreSQLallows an object creator to execute arbitrary SQL functions as the userrunning pg_dump, which is often a superuser. The attack involves replacinganother relation type with a view or foreign table. The attack requireswaiting for pg_dump to start, but winning the race condition is trivial ifthe attacker retains an open transaction. Versions before PostgreSQL 16.4,15.8, 14.13, 13.16, and 12.20 are affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-7348` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
libecpg6 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
libpgtypes3 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
libpq5 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
postgresql-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
postgresql-client-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2').
